Package org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.pedroPathing.follower

Class Follower

java.lang.Object
org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.pedroPathing.follower.Follower
public class Follower extends Object
This is the Follower class. It handles the actual following of the paths and all the on-the-fly calculations that are relevant for movement.

    • Follower

      public Follower(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap hardwareMap)
      This creates a new Follower given a HardwareMap.
      Parameters:
      hardwareMap - HardwareMap required

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      This initializes the follower. In this, the DriveVectorScaler and PoseUpdater is instantiated, the drive motors are initialized and their behavior is set, and the variables involved in approximating first and second derivatives for teleop are set.

    • setMaxPower

      public void setMaxPower(double set)
      This sets the maximum power the motors are allowed to use.
      Parameters:
      set - This caps the motor power from [0, 1].

    • limitDrivePowers

      public void limitDrivePowers()
      This handles the limiting of the drive powers array to the max power.

    • getPointFromPath

      public Point getPointFromPath(double t)
      This gets a Point from the current Path from a specified t-value.
      Returns:
      returns the Point.

    • getPose

      public Pose getPose()
      This returns the current pose from the PoseUpdater.
      Returns:
      returns the pose

    • setPose

      public void setPose(Pose pose)
      This sets the current pose in the PoseUpdater without using offsets.
      Parameters:
      pose - The pose to set the current pose to.

    • getVelocity

      public Vector getVelocity()
      This returns the current velocity of the robot as a Vector.
      Returns:
      returns the current velocity as a Vector.

    • getAcceleration

      public Vector getAcceleration()
      This returns the current acceleration of the robot as a Vector.
      Returns:
      returns the current acceleration as a Vector.

    • getVelocityMagnitude

      public double getVelocityMagnitude()
      This returns the magnitude of the current velocity. For when you only need the magnitude.
      Returns:
      returns the magnitude of the current velocity.

    • setStartingPose

      public void setStartingPose(Pose pose)
      This sets the starting pose. Do not run this after moving at all.
      Parameters:
      pose - the pose to set the starting pose to.

    • setCurrentPoseWithOffset

      public void setCurrentPoseWithOffset(Pose set)
      This sets the current pose, using offsets so no reset time delay. This is better than the Road Runner reset, in general. Think of using offsets as setting trim in an aircraft. This can be reset as well, so beware of using the resetOffset() method.
      Parameters:
      set - The pose to set the current pose to.

    • setXOffset

      public void setXOffset(double xOffset)
      This sets the offset for only the x position.
      Parameters:
      xOffset - This sets the offset.

    • setYOffset

      public void setYOffset(double yOffset)
      This sets the offset for only the y position.
      Parameters:
      yOffset - This sets the offset.

    • setHeadingOffset

      public void setHeadingOffset(double headingOffset)
      This sets the offset for only the heading.
      Parameters:
      headingOffset - This sets the offset.

    • getXOffset

      public double getXOffset()
      This returns the x offset.
      Returns:
      returns the x offset.

    • getYOffset

      public double getYOffset()
      This returns the y offset.
      Returns:
      returns the y offset.

    • getHeadingOffset

      public double getHeadingOffset()
      This returns the heading offset.
      Returns:
      returns the heading offset.

    • resetOffset

      public void resetOffset()
      This resets all offsets set to the PoseUpdater. If you have reset your pose using the setCurrentPoseUsingOffset(Pose set) method, then your pose will be returned to what the PoseUpdater thinks your pose would be, not the pose you reset to.

    • holdPoint

      public void holdPoint(BezierPoint point, double heading)
      This holds a Point.
      Parameters:
      point - the Point to stay at.
      heading - the heading to face.

    • followPath

      public void followPath(Path path, boolean holdEnd)
      This follows a Path. This also makes the Follower hold the last Point on the Path.
      Parameters:
      path - the Path to follow.

    • followPath

      public void followPath(Path path)
      This follows a Path.
      Parameters:
      path - the Path to follow.

    • followPath

      public void followPath(PathChain pathChain, boolean holdEnd)
      This follows a PathChain. Drive vector projection is only done on the last Path. This also makes the Follower hold the last Point on the PathChain.
      Parameters:
      pathChain - the PathChain to follow.

    • followPath

      public void followPath(PathChain pathChain)
      This follows a PathChain. Drive vector projection is only done on the last Path.
      Parameters:
      pathChain - the PathChain to follow.

    • startTeleopDrive

      public void startTeleopDrive()
      This starts teleop drive control.

    • update

      public void update()
      This calls an update to the PoseUpdater, which updates the robot's current position estimate. This also updates all the Follower's PIDFs, which updates the motor powers.

    • setTeleOpMovementVectors

      public void setTeleOpMovementVectors(double forwardDrive, double lateralDrive, double heading)
      This sets the teleop drive vectors. This defaults to robot centric.
      Parameters:
      forwardDrive - determines the forward drive vector for the robot in teleop. In field centric movement, this is the x-axis.
      lateralDrive - determines the lateral drive vector for the robot in teleop. In field centric movement, this is the y-axis.
      heading - determines the heading vector for the robot in teleop.

    • setTeleOpMovementVectors

      public void setTeleOpMovementVectors(double forwardDrive, double lateralDrive, double heading, boolean robotCentric)
      This sets the teleop drive vectors.
      Parameters:
      forwardDrive - determines the forward drive vector for the robot in teleop. In field centric movement, this is the x-axis.
      lateralDrive - determines the lateral drive vector for the robot in teleop. In field centric movement, this is the y-axis.
      heading - determines the heading vector for the robot in teleop.
      robotCentric - sets if the movement will be field or robot centric

    • calculateAveragedVelocityAndAcceleration

      public void calculateAveragedVelocityAndAcceleration()
      This calculates an averaged approximate velocity and acceleration. This is used for a real-time correction of centripetal force, which is used in teleop.

    • updateCallbacks

      public void updateCallbacks()
      This checks if any PathCallbacks should be run right now, and runs them if applicable.

    • breakFollowing

      public void breakFollowing()
      This resets the PIDFs and stops following the current Path.

    • isBusy

      public boolean isBusy()
      This returns if the Follower is currently following a Path or a PathChain.
      Returns:
      returns if the Follower is busy.

    • getDriveVector

      public Vector getDriveVector()
      This returns a Vector in the direction the robot must go to move along the path. This Vector takes into account the projected position of the robot to calculate how much power is needed.

      Note: This vector is clamped to be at most 1 in magnitude.

      Returns:
      returns the drive vector.

    • getDriveVelocityError

      public double getDriveVelocityError()
      This returns the velocity the robot needs to be at to make it to the end of the Path at some specified deceleration (well technically just some negative acceleration).
      Returns:
      returns the projected velocity.

    • getHeadingVector

      public Vector getHeadingVector()
      This returns a Vector in the direction of the robot that contains the heading correction as its magnitude. Positive heading correction turns the robot counter-clockwise, and negative heading correction values turn the robot clockwise. So basically, Pedro Pathing uses a right- handed coordinate system.

      Note: This vector is clamped to be at most 1 in magnitude.

      Returns:
      returns the heading vector.

    • getCorrectiveVector

      public Vector getCorrectiveVector()
      This returns a combined Vector in the direction the robot must go to correct both translational error as well as centripetal force.

      Note: This vector is clamped to be at most 1 in magnitude.

      Returns:
      returns the corrective vector.

    • getTranslationalCorrection

      public Vector getTranslationalCorrection()
      This returns a Vector in the direction the robot must go to account for only translational error.

      Note: This vector is clamped to be at most 1 in magnitude.

      Returns:
      returns the translational correction vector.

    • getTranslationalError

      public Vector getTranslationalError()
      This returns the raw translational error, or how far off the closest point the robot is.
      Returns:
      This returns the raw translational error as a Vector.

    • getCentripetalForceCorrection

      public Vector getCentripetalForceCorrection()
      This returns a Vector in the direction the robot must go to account for only centripetal force.

      Note: This vector is clamped to be between [0, 1] in magnitude.

      Returns:
      returns the centripetal force correction vector.

    • getClosestPose

      public Pose getClosestPose()
      This returns the closest pose to the robot on the Path the Follower is currently following. This closest pose is calculated through a binary search method with some specified number of steps to search. By default, 10 steps are used, which should be more than enough.
      Returns:
      returns the closest pose.

    • atParametricEnd

      public boolean atParametricEnd()
      This returns whether the follower is at the parametric end of its current Path. The parametric end is determined by if the closest Point t-value is greater than some specified end t-value. If running a PathChain, this returns true only if at parametric end of last Path in the PathChain.
      Returns:
      returns whether the Follower is at the parametric end of its Path.

    • getCurrentTValue

      public double getCurrentTValue()
      This returns the t value of the closest point on the current Path to the robot In the absence of a current Path, it returns 1.0.
      Returns:
      returns the current t value.

    • getCurrentPathNumber

      public double getCurrentPathNumber()
      This returns the current path number. For following Paths, this will return 0. For PathChains, this will return the current path number. For holding Points, this will also return 0.
      Returns:
      returns the current path number.

    • pathBuilder

      public PathBuilder pathBuilder()
      This returns a new PathBuilder object for easily building PathChains.
      Returns:
      returns a new PathBuilder object.

    • telemetryDebug

      public void telemetryDebug(com.acmerobotics.dashboard.telemetry.MultipleTelemetry telemetry)
      This writes out information about the various motion Vectors to the Telemetry specified.
      Parameters:
      telemetry - this is an instance of Telemetry or the FTC Dashboard telemetry that this method will use to output the debug data.

    • telemetryDebug

      public void telemetryDebug(org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.Telemetry telemetry)
      This writes out information about the various motion Vectors to the Telemetry specified.
      Parameters:
      telemetry - this is an instance of Telemetry or the FTC Dashboard telemetry that this method will use to output the debug data.

    • getTotalHeading

      public double getTotalHeading()
      This returns the total number of radians the robot has turned.
      Returns:
      the total heading.

    • getCurrentPath

      public Path getCurrentPath()
      This returns the current Path the Follower is following. This can be null.
      Returns:
      returns the current Path.

    • getDashboardPoseTracker

      public DashboardPoseTracker getDashboardPoseTracker()
      This returns the pose tracker for the robot to draw on the Dashboard.
      Returns:
      returns the pose tracker

    • resetIMU

      public void resetIMU()
      This resets the IMU, if applicable.
